lesson.title: Create a new Xamarin.Android project using Visual Studio
lesson.description: Create a new Couchbase Lite project for Xamarin.Android in Visual Studio

introduction.paragraph: This lesson describes how to set up the Couchbase Lite environment for Xamarin.Android using Visual Studio.

body.paragraph: Before you can build an app, you need to set up your development environment:

list-item.paragraph: Download and install Xamarin. The Xamarin installer will install everything you need to develop using Xamarin.Android.
Download the Xamarin Android Player. The Xamarin Android Player provides a much faster emulator than the ones that come with the Android SDK.
Under the Xamarin Android Player's Devices section, download one (or more) of the Android device images. For this tutorial we'll be using the Nexus 5 (Lollipop) image shown below:
After the device image download completes, enter Couchbase Lite Tutorial for the device name and select OK:
Once the device image install completes it will appear in the Installed Devices section:
In the Start Page choose New Project.
In the New Project window, select Android > Blank App, enter Couchbase Events for the application name and click OK:

body.paragraph: To use Couchbase-Lite in your Xamarin.Android project, you need to add the Couchbase Lite package from NuGet. You can do this using the built-in NuGet support in Visual Studio.

list-item.paragraph: Right-click the CouchbaseEvents project in the Solution Explorer and select Manage NuGet Packages to open the NuGet Package dialog.
Search for Couchbase Lite, select it from the list, and click Install to add Couchbase Lite along with its dependencies to the project.

body.paragraph: Running the empty app at this point verifies everying is set up correctly.

list-item.paragraph: In the Android Player, start the Couchbase Lite Tutorial emulator image you created earlier.
After the emulator has started, in the Visual Studio tool bar, set the emulator to Couchbase Lite Tutorial and click the run button.

body.paragraph: This will install the shared runtime, install the app, and launch it.
